future_technology.overview: This document outlines the technological advancements required to achieve fully automated vulnerability scanning, encompassing sensing, control, mechanical, and software aspects. The timeframe for realization spans 5-15 years, with significant research gaps requiring focused investment.

sensory_systems.name: Advanced Spectroscopic Imaging (HSI & Raman)
sensory_systems.description: Hyperspectral Imaging (HSI) and Raman spectroscopy combined to analyze material composition and identify anomalies indicative of compromised hardware or software. HSI will provide broader spectral data, while Raman will pinpoint specific materials.
sensory_systems.technical_specifications: HSI: Spectral resolution 5-10 nm, spatial resolution 50-100 μm, coverage area up to 1m², sensitivity 10⁻⁶ absorbance units. Raman: Laser wavelength 785nm or 1064nm, spectral resolution 1-5 cm⁻¹, signal-to-noise ratio > 10.
sensory_systems.accuracy_metrics: Vulnerability identification rate: >85% for known vulnerabilities, >60% for zero-day vulnerabilities.

sensory_systems.name: Embedded Acoustic Sensors (Anomaly Detection)
sensory_systems.description: Arrays of highly sensitive microphones to detect anomalous sounds – hard drive clicks, fan noise, CPU thermal throttling, indicating potential compromises.
sensory_systems.technical_specifications: Frequency range: 20 Hz - 20 kHz, sensitivity: -70 dB, noise floor < 10 μPa, number of sensors: 10-100, spatially distributed.
sensory_systems.accuracy_metrics: Anomaly detection rate: >90% for hardware failures, >75% for malware activity.

sensory_systems.name: Thermal Imaging (CPU & Component Monitoring)
sensory_systems.description: Real-time thermal imaging of server components (CPU, GPU, RAM) to detect overheating and performance anomalies, often precursors to hardware failures or exploits.
sensory_systems.technical_specifications: Resolution: 64x64 or 128x128 pixels, spectral range: 8-14 μm, accuracy: ±0.5°C, field of view: 10cm - 1m.
sensory_systems.accuracy_metrics: Overheating detection rate: >95% for critical components.

control_systems.name: Reinforcement Learning-Based Control Loops
control_systems.description: RL agents to dynamically adjust system settings (clock speed, fan speeds, power limits) based on sensor data to mitigate identified vulnerabilities or proactively prevent future attacks.
control_systems.technical_specifications: Response time: < 10ms, adaptation rate: 1-10 Hz, reward function based on security metrics and performance.
control_systems.accuracy_metrics: Vulnerability containment time: < 30 seconds, system performance degradation < 5%.

control_systems.name: Adaptive Threat Response Orchestration
control_systems.description: Centralized control system that integrates all sensing and control systems, executing pre-defined and dynamically generated response actions.
control_systems.technical_specifications: Scalability: Support 1000+ servers, response time < 50ms, integration with SIEM/SOAR systems.
control_systems.accuracy_metrics: Time to patch: < 1 hour, reduction in attack surface.

mechanical_systems.name: Modular Server Chassis (Automated Component Replacement)
mechanical_systems.description: Server chassis incorporating modular components (CPU, RAM, storage) designed for rapid automated replacement using robotic arms.
mechanical_systems.technical_specifications: Robot arm precision: ±0.1mm, replacement time: < 60 seconds per component, support for standard server form factors.
mechanical_systems.accuracy_metrics: Component replacement success rate: >99%, minimal system downtime.

mechanical_systems.name: Self-Healing Hardware (Redundant Systems)
mechanical_systems.description: Server hardware with built-in redundancy and self-repair capabilities, using microfluidic systems and miniature robotic actuators.
mechanical_systems.technical_specifications: Component failure rate reduction: >50%, automatic reboot/restart capabilities.

software_integration.name: AI-Powered Vulnerability Prioritization
software_integration.description: Machine learning models to automatically assess the severity and exploitability of vulnerabilities based on contextual data (system configuration, threat intelligence).
software_integration.technical_specifications: Accuracy: >90% in vulnerability classification, integration with vulnerability databases (NVD, CVE).

software_integration.name: Digital Twin Technology
software_integration.description: Creation of a dynamic digital replica of the server infrastructure, continuously updated with sensor data and system state, enabling real-time simulation and impact analysis.

software_integration.name: Secure Federated Learning Framework
software_integration.description: Allows for the training of vulnerability detection models across multiple servers without sharing raw data, enhancing privacy and scalability.
software_integration.technical_specifications: Data privacy: Differential privacy techniques implemented, model accuracy comparable to centralized training.
software_integration.accuracy_metrics: Model performance similar to centralized training.

key_research_areas: Development of robust and energy-efficient sensing technologies
Miniaturization and integration of self-repairing hardware
Formal verification of AI-based control systems
Quantum computing for threat analysis and cryptographic protection

input.system_message: You are an AI assistant specialized in forecasting future automation technologies. For the given topic, provide a comprehensive overview of technologies that would need to be created or refined to enable full automation in this field. Focus on realistic technological advancements that could be achieved in the next 5-15 years. For each technology, include specific technical specifications and accuracy metrics where appropriate.
input.user_message:
Create a detailed overview of future technologies needed for full automation of: Automated Vulnerability Scanning

Format your response as a JSON object with these categories:
1. sensory_systems: Array of sensing technologies with descriptions and accuracy metrics
2. control_systems: Array of control mechanisms and their capabilities
3. mechanical_systems: Array of physical components and their specifications
4. software_integration: Array of software technologies needed to coordinate everything
5. timeline_estimate: Estimated years until these technologies could be realized
6. key_research_areas: Array of critical research domains that need breakthroughs

Please return ONLY valid JSON without any additional text, explanation, or code block formatting.
